title: Do you underline movie titles? - Quora

response.answer_text: You italicize movie titles. Underlining is a form of italicization. However, with word processing having overtaken typewriters, it’s usually possible to use classic italics instead of underscoring, like so: Citizen Kane Miracle on 34th Street On the Waterfront Stagecoach Star Wars However, if all you have is a typewriter, or if you are hand-writing, underlining is the way one italicizes.

In  a previous age, before computers, we underlined the titles of books, movies and plays.  This is still the correct method when handwriting, during an exam for instance.  However, when we type on the computer, the usual convention now is to use italics.  That's the slanted I button next to the B for bold.
